Doctor’s Name  
Doctor’s Address  

Dear Doctor,

I am writing to introduce my patient, A, who will be seeing you soon. He is a friendly young man who has bulbar cerebral palsy and low muscle tone (hypotonia). He has been treated by Dr. X at the pediatric neurology clinic. Dr. X recently noted that he has trouble breathing through his mouth, which is affecting his speech. She also confirmed that he has enlarged tonsils. We are wondering if removing his tonsils might help his breathing, swallowing, and speech.

For his long‑standing allergic rhinitis, he uses Flonase (two sprays in each nostril once a day) and takes Zyrtec 10 mg daily, but these only give partial relief. He is allergic to penicillin.

I would appreciate your opinion on his care. If you have any questions, please call my office. I look forward to hearing from you about his evaluation.

Thank you.
